gui_text_real2

This component is used to create a widget to display a 32-bit floating point value in the GUI, where the value is specified by the data input [In]data. The position, dimensions, colour and transparency of the widget are specified in the widget properties in the GUI Builder, IGB. In addition the data inputs [In]off.x and [In]off.y can be used to change the position of the widget by specifying the offset from its original position in the x and y axis respectively. The data inputs [In]off.wid and [In]off.ht can be used to specify an offset in the width and the height of the widget from the original dimensions and [In]alpha can be used to change the alpha value of the transparency of the widget. Note that if the property Maintain Aspect Ratio is set to TRUE then changes to the widget width using the data input [In]off.wid also change the height to maintain the aspect ratio and changes to height using the data input [In]off.ht are ignored.

The input event [In]create will allocate the memory for the widget and [In]destroy will deallocate the memory. When the input event [In]create is triggered, data is presented to outputs [Out]abs x, [Out]abs y, [Out]wid and [Out]ht, describing the absolute position and dimensions of the widget as created.

The input events [In]show and [In]hide will show and hide the widget. The state of the widget as shown or hidden is persistent, so that if [In]show fires before [In]create, the widget will be shown when [In]create fires.

When the input event [In]update fires, the values presented to the inputs [In]off.x, [In]off.y, [In]off.wid, [In]off.ht and [In]alpha will be used to update the widget properties. Data is presented to outputs [Out]abs x, [Out]abs y, [Out]wid and [Out]ht, describing the updated absolute position and dimensions of the widget. It should be noted that the data inputs [In]off.x and [In]off.y specify the offset in the x and y axis from its original position and the data outputs [Out]abs x and [Out]abs y refer to the absolute x and y coordinates of the widget in reference to the viewport. This allows the data output to be used to detect if widgets are overlapping in the GUI.

Ports

  • [In] create:

    Input event, allocates memory for the widget.

  • [In] destroy:

    Input event, deallocates memory for the widget.

  • [In] show:

    Input event, shows the widget in the GUI.

  • [In] hide:

    Input event, hides the widget in the GUI.

  • [In] update:

    Input event, updates the properties of the widget.

  • [In] off.x:

    Data input, specifies the offset in the x axis of the widget from its initial position when the update event fires.

  • [In] off.y:

    Data input, specifies the offset in the y axis of the widget from its initial position when the update event fires.

  • [In] off.wid:

    Data input, specifies the offset in width of the widget from its original dimensions when the update event fires.

  • [In] off.ht:

    Data input, specifies the offset in height of the widget from its original dimensions when the update event fires.

  • [In] alpha:

    Data input, specifies the alpha transparency of the widget when the update event fires.

  • [In] data:

    Data input, specifies the data to be displayed in the widget.

  • [Out] abs x:

    Data output, the x coordinate of the widget relative to the viewport origin presented when the create or update events are triggered.

  • [Out] abs y:

    Data output, the y coordinate of the widget relative to the viewport origin presented when the create or update events are triggered.

  • [Out] wid:

    Data output, the width of the widget presented when the create or update events are triggered.

  • [Out] ht:

    Data output, the height of the widget presented when the create or update events are triggered.

  • [Out] :

    Output event, triggered when the input event [In]create fires.

  • [Out] :

    Output event, triggered when the input event [In]destroy fires.

  • [Out] :

    Output event, triggered when the input event [In]show fires.

  • [Out] :

    Output event, triggered when the input event [In]hide fires.

  • [Out] :

    Output event, triggered when the input event [In]update fires.

  • [Out] click:

    Output event, triggered when the user clicks on the widget in the GUI.

  • [Out] mouse down:

    Output event, triggered when the user presses the mouse button and the pointer is over the widget.

Parameters

  • Widget Tag:

    Name of the widget as displayed in the GUI builder.

    Data Type:

    WT,

    Min Value:

    widget,

    Max Value:

    widget tag,

    Default Value:

    None

  • Widget-Group:

    Group that the widget belongs to in the GUI builder.

    Data Type:

    ST,

    Min Value:

    default,

    Max Value:

    widget group,

    Default Value:

    None

  • Maintain Aspect Ratio:

    Maintains aspect ratio of widget when width is changed and ignores changes in height if TRUE, allows width and height to be altered independently if FALSE.

    Data Type:

    B,

    Default Value:

    0

  • Register Click Disregarding Z-Order:

    Allows a widget to register a mouse click event when it is hidden behind another widget if TRUE, the widget only registers mouse clicks if the widget is visible at the coords that the mouse click occurs at if FALSE.

    Data Type:

    B,

    Default Value:

    0

State Machine

Stateless.

Profiles

All.

Toolbox

GUI.

Version

v2.1.

Native Dependencies

  • TDK1.1:

Licence Type

LGPL.

Component Supplier

inx ltd.
